metadata.Title: CVE-2021-30547 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Out of bounds write in ANGLE in Google Chrome prior to 91.0.4472.101 allowed a remote attacker to potentially perform out of bounds memory access via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30547` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 91.0.4472.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 91.0.4472.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 91.0.4472.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 91.0.4472.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 91.0.4472.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

firefox - 90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 19.10, the chromium-browser package is just a script that installs the Chromium snap

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '91.0.4472.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
